elements.name: ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your name?
elements.description: You may enter a name you use in your everday life even if it does not match your ID exactly.

elements.name: ApplicantDOB
elements.title: What is your Date of Birth?

elements.name: ExplanationServiceAddress
elements.title: You need to give an address where you can receive court documents. You do not have to use your home address. You can pick any address, such as your workplace or a lawyer's address, if you have one. The family member making you or your family feel unsafe will see this address.

elements.name: ApplicantAddress
elements.title: What is your address for receiving court documents?

elements.name: LawyerAddress
elements.title: Is this a lawyer's address?
elements.description: You can use one if you pay your lawyer to send and receive mail for you.

elements.name: LawyerName
elements.title: What is the lawyer's name?

elements.name: LawyerEmail
elements.title: Lawyer's Email (Optional)

elements.name: LawyerPhone
elements.title: Lawyer's Phone Number

elements.name: LawyerFax
elements.title: Lawyer's Fax Number (Optional)

elements.name: ApplicantPhone
elements.title: Daytime Phone Number

elements.name: ApplicantFax
elements.title: Fax Number (Optional)

elements.name: ApplicantEmail
elements.title: Email (Optional)

elements.name: ApplicantPageEnd
elements.title: Finished this page. You can add children and other adults later if you need to.

elements.name: Respondent1Name
elements.title: What is the name of the person that is making you (or your family) feel unsafe?
elements.description: If you know how their name is written on their ID cards, that will be the most useful.
elements.placeHolder: Full Name Here If you know it

elements.name: Respondent1IsExPartner
elements.title: Is {respondent1.name} a current or ex-partner of {applicant.name}?

elements.name: Respondent1IsChildsParent
elements.title: Is {respondent1.name} a parent or guardian of any of {applicant.name}'s child?

elements.name: Respondent1IsChildParentsRelative
elements.title: Is {respondent1.name} a relative of {applicant.name}'s child's parent or guardian?

elements.name: Respondent1IsExPartnersPartner
elements.title: Is {respondent1.name} a current partner of {applicant.name}'s ex-partner?

elements.name: Respondent1IsLiveInRelative
elements.title: Is {respondent1.name} a relative of {applicant.name} who lives with {applicant.name}?

elements.name: Respondent1NotFamily
elements.title: {respondent1.name} needs to be a family member of {applicant.name} (or their children). You can't just put in any random citizen. Try a peace bond maybe.

elements.name: Respondent1DOB
elements.title: What is {respondent1.name}'s date of birth?
elements.description: You can still use this service without this information. A Protection Order is most effective with this information.

elements.name: Respondent1DOBIDK
elements.title: I don't know the exact date

elements.name: Respondent1Address
elements.title: What is an address where {Respondent1} can receive court documents?
elements.description: You can pick a daytime address such as {respondent1.name}'s workplace or somewhere you know {respondent1.name} will be staying.

elements.name: Respondent1Phone
elements.title: Daytime Phone Number

elements.name: Respondent1Fax
elements.title: Fax Number (Optional)

elements.name: Respondent1Email
elements.title: Email (Optional)

elements.name: ExistingFamilyCasePanel
ExistingFamilyCase
elements.title: Is there already a Family Law case open between {applicant.name} and {respondent1.name} in the Provincial Court of British Columbia?

elements.name: ExistingCourt
elements.title: Court Location

elements.name: ExistingFileNumber
elements.title: File Number

elements.name: ExistingStyleOfProceeding
elements.title: Spell out the exact Style of Proceeding
elements.description: This is at the top of the documents and usually looks like "Name1 vs Name2".

elements.title: Existing Family Case Information

elements.name: ChildrenInvolved
elements.title: Does {applicant.name} and/or {respondent1.name} have children?

elements.name: ChildrenAmount
elements.title: What is the total number of children that have {applicant.name} and {respondent1.name} have?

elements.name: Child1Panel
Child1Name
elements.title: What is the child's name?

elements.name: Child1DOB
elements.title: Date of Birth

choices.text: I don't know {child1.name}'s exact date of birth but I know they are 19 or older
I don't know {child1.name}'s exact date of birth but I know they are younger than 19

elements.name: Child1IsAdult
elements.title: [Need Help - Placeholder for validation to determine if Child1 is an adult]

elements.name: Child1AdultCare
elements.title: [Need Help - If No is selected, cancel other selections] {child1.name} is considered an adult. Does {child1.name} depend on either {applicant.name} or {respondent1.name} for any of the following reasons?

elements.name: Child1ApplicantCare
elements.title: Is {applicant.name} provide financing support to {child1.name} for any of these situations?

elements.name: Child1Respondent1Care
elements.title: Is {resondent1.name} providing financing support to {child1.name} for any of these situations?

elements.name: Child1NeedsProtection
elements.title: Does {child1.name} need to be included on the Family Law Protection Order against {respondent1.name}?

elements.name: ExplanationChild1IsAdultNoProtectionNo
elements.title: Even if {child1.name} does not need to be included in the Protection Order, the judge will still need information about {child1.name} in order to make fair decision.

elements.name: ExplanationChild1IsAdultNoPOR
elements.title: Because {child1.name} is an adult, not supported financially for a special obligation and does not need to be included in the Protection Order, {child1.name} will not be included on your documents.

elements.name: Child1RelationshipWApplicant
elements.title: How is {applicant.name} related to {child1.name}?

elements.name: Child1RelationshipWRespondent1
elements.title: How is {respondent1.name} related to {child1.name}?

elements.name: Child1PanelGuardianship
Child1ApplicantGuardian
elements.title: Is {applicant.name} a guardian of {child1.name}?

elements.name: Child1Respondent1Guardian
elements.title: Is {respondent1.name} a guardian of {child1.name}?
Guardianship is not the same as being parent. Here is what guardian means...

Child1ApplicantPTime
elements.title: Does {applicant.name} spend time with {child1.name}?

elements.name: Child1Respondent1PTime
elements.title: Does {respondent1.name} spend time with {child1.name}?

elements.name: Child1EqualPTime
elements.title: Does {child1.name} spend time equally between {applicant.name} and {respondent1.name}?
elements.description: Visible If {child1} spends time with more than 1 Guardian

elements.name: Child1MainGuardians
elements.title: Who does {child1.name} spend the most time with?

elements.name: Child1ApplicantUnequalPTime
elements.title: How much time does {respondent1.name} spend with {child1.name}?

elements.title: How much time does {applicant.name} spend with {child1.name}?
Parenting Time

Child1ApplicantPDecisions
elements.title: Can {applicant.name} make parenting decisions for {child1.name}?

elements.title: Can {respondent1.name} make parenting decisions for {child1.name}?
Parenting Decisions

Child1ApplicantContact
elements.title: Does {applicant.name} have contact with {child1.name}?

elements.title: Is there an agreement or court order respecting this contact?

choices.text: As agreed upon to between {applicant.name} and {respondent1.name}

choices.text: As agreed upon to between {applicant.name} and {respondent1.name}

elements.title: Orders Respecting Contact

elements.name: NoContactRespondent1Summary
PORPanelNoContactExceptions
Respondent1ApplicantContact
elements.title: Would {respondent1.name} need to contact {applicant.name} for an ongoing court case?

elements.name: Respondent1ApplicantContactParties
elements.title: Are there any third parties that {respondent1.name} and {applicant.name} can communicate through?

elements.name: Respondent1ApplicantArrangeChildren
elements.title: [Need help with logic - If there is at least one child who does not need protection] Does {respondent1.name} need to contact you to arrange parenting responsibilities?

elements.name: Respondent1ApplicantArrangeMethods
elements.title: What is your preferred method for {respondent1.name} to contact you?

elements.name: Respondent1ApplicantContactOther
elements.title: Is there any other reason that {respondent1.name} would need to contact you?

elements.name: Respondent1ApplicantContactOtherReason
elements.title: Describe the reason(s)?
Even with a Protection Order in place, there may be times where it is important to contact each other.

elements.name: Respondent1LiveTogether
elements.title: Does {respondent1.name} currently live with {applicant.name} or {child1.name}?
elements.description: we'll need lots of info here or expanding question topic about what it means to "currently live" with someone. in other words, ran away to a shelter/couch surfing vs moved out a month ago. FLA 184(4)

elements.name: Respondent1Leaving
elements.title: Do you, {applicant.name}, want to stay in the family home?

elements.name: Respondent1NeedPolice
elements.title: Do you think you need the police to remove {respondent1.name} from your family home or are they leaving on their own?

choices.text: {respondent1.name} will probably leave on their own

elements.name: HomeAddressSame
elements.title: Is the address of your family home the same as the address you provided for receiving court documents? [Display applicant's service address]

elements.name: FamilyHomeAddress
elements.title: What is the address of your family home?

elements.name: Respondent1HasStuff
elements.title: Does {respondent1.name} have any of [list of pending protected parties]'s personal belongings?

elements.name: Respondent1HasStuffPolice
elements.title: Do you think you need police assistance to get personal belongings from {respondent1.name}?

elements.name: Respondent1HasStuffAddressSame
elements.title: Same as {respondent1.name}'s address that you provided for receiving court documents? [Display respondent's service address]

elements.name: Respondent1HasStuffAddress
elements.title: What is the address where your personal belongs are being held?

elements.name: Respondent1NeedsStuff
elements.title: Does [names of pending protected parties] have any {respondent1.name}'s personal belongings?
elements.description: Leave out the stolen items. make the help text more about clothing and daily-needed items. the whole point is to avoid having to come back and forth to grab stuff each time.

elements.name: Respondent1NeedsStuffPolice
elements.title: Does you need the police to go with {respondent1.name} to get their personal belongings from you?

elements.name: Respondent1NeedsStuffAddressSame
elements.title: Is the address where you are holding {respondent1.name}'s personal belongings the same as the address you provided for receiving court documents? [Display applicant's service address]

elements.name: Respondent1NeedsStuffAddress
elements.title: Address

elements.name: Respondent1NoGo
elements.title: Are there any places, other than your home, where {respondent1.name} needs to stay away from?

elements.name: ExplanationNoGoAddresses
elements.title: For this service, you do not need to give the addresses of the places you want {respondent1.name} to stay away from. However, the judge may request them for the Protection Order so be prepared to bring the address into the courtroom with you.

elements.name: Respondent1Weapons
elements.title: Are you afraid [Respondent] will harm you or family members with weapons (including guns, explosives)?

elements.name: Respondent1NoWeapons
elements.title: By selecting no above, you are saying there is no need for a judge to order {respondent1.name} to give up their weapons if they have any. They also won't be able to possess any weapons for the duration of this Protection Order. If there is no concern over weapons, select "There is no concern over weapons" Otherwise, consider going back to the last question and selecting 'yes' instead.

choices.text: There is no concern over weapons

elements.name: Resident1Firearms
elements.title: Do you think {respondent1.name} has guns, explosives or any other kind of firearm?

elements.name: Respondent1NonFirearms
elements.title: Do you think {respondent1.name} has weapons that are not guns or explosives?
elements.description: Knives are for cooking but could be used a weapon. Say Yes if they're particularly stabby but no if they're just an avid cook. Use this quesiton as a place to define what weapons are and why we are asking. Use definition of Criminal Code.

elements.name: ApplicationReview
elements.title: This is a review of everything. Show the box and show summary. Edit button to go back to topic page.

elements.name: Respondent1PORTime
elements.title: Protection Orders usually last 1 year from the date the judge makes the order. Do you wish to make the order last a different amount of time?

elements.name: Respondent1PORNewTime
elements.title: What date do you think the POR should expire?
elements.description: You will need to explain to the judge why you think this new date matters.

elements.name: Respondent1CarryCopy
elements.title: Do you need [Respondent1] to carry a copy of this order (if it is granted) on their person at all times for the duration of order.

elements.name: ExplanationDoneMainForm
elements.title: Tell someone they finish the form. This is what it looks like. Here's next steps. By the way, urgency questions

elements.name: PORSpeedup
elements.title: Do you feel you need this protection order sooner?

elements.name: PORSpeed
elements.title: How soon do you need this protection order?

elements.name: PORSpeedNormalAffidavit
elements.title: Does you want to write an affidavit using this service?
elements.description: Writing an affidavit is optional. Some judges really like it and may actually request it at a later date.

elements.name: ExplanationYesSpeedup
elements.title: This means that you need fill out more forms and wait for a judge to decide whether they will hear you or not.

elements.name: PORWhatHappened
elements.title: Q1 What Happened? (This stuff should not be saved into the database)

elements.name: PORWhyASAP
elements.title: Q2 Why do you need the POR Faster? (This stuff should not be saved into the database)

elements.name: PORWhyNoNotice
elements.title: Q3 Why do you need the POR granted with no notice? (This stuff should not be saved into the database)

elements.name: PageEndReview
elements.title: Print Forms and take them to the courthouse
